text:
Here are five questions
you should ask before moving
to the cloud.

Number one: Is there a clear
business reason to move to the
cloud?

Moving to the cloud because
your competitors are isn’t
reason enough to make the move.

You need to ensure there is a deep
understanding of how this will

benefit your organization
and drive your business
objectives.

The reasons that many customers
decide to move to the cloud

include cost savings, scalability,
flexibility, security,
and innovation.

Linking the value of a digital
transformation to your overall

corporate objectives is one of
the keys to success.

Secondly, are the CFO and the CIO
aligned on the cloud strategy?

It is crucial for the two of you
to work together through

any concerns on the frontend
because the cloud can significantly

impact the financials
of your organization
and the IT infrastructure.

By working together, you can
both ensure that the organization’s

cloud strategy aligns with its
financial and IT goals.

This will improve decision
making, operational efficiency,

and ultimately, lead to greater
business success.

The third question is: What is
the actual cost of migrating
to the cloud?

It is important to carefully
evaluate the cost.

The cost can vary widely depending
on the size and complexity

of your IT infrastructure,
the number of workloads

being migrated and potentially
modernized, as well as the number
of cloud providers you engage.

Some of the main costs include
migration, training, and the
ongoing cost of cloud services.

You need to balance these costs
against the expected value.

Spending money in the cloud
isn’t a problem, but wasting
money can be.

The fourth question is: How does
governance change (if at all)
when moving to the cloud?

When moving to the cloud,
governance may need to change

to accommodate the unique
characteristics of the cloud
environment.

From a financial standpoint,
you need to consider the variable

nature of cloud services
and consider the type of monitoring,

alerting, and reporting
needed to ensure leaders

are accountable for the cost
of using cloud services.

Thinking through the changes
and leaning on experienced

professionals who have gone
through this journey will ensure

you are fully prepared for the
cloud migration and governance.

The fifth question is: What
role will the cloud play in influencing
finance?

The cloud can impact many finance
and accounting functions
within an organization.

It may impact your processes
as applications and systems

evolve, as well as the way you
work.

But given all of the benefits
we have already spoken about,

finance can become more efficient
and effective, make better

informed decisions, and help
your organization achieve
greater financial success.
